result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Daselle Robinson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Daselle Robinson appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for James Daselle Robinson.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah M Dahdouh appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and has not received an offer from the state.  
Defense requested motion hearing date.  Defense motion to be filed on or before 12/1/2022. State's response, if appropriate, to be filed on or before 1/3/2023.  D
Case remains calendared in Branch 30.
Motion hearing scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Due to Court being down 10/7/2022, parties agreed via email to reschedule the 10/7/2022 pretrial conference to 11/1/2022 at 2:00 p.m. by zoom.

Defendant James Daselle Robinson in court.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/15/22 @ 2p
